topics.name: Experimentation
topics.description: A/B testing, variance reduction, sequential testing, interference

papers.title: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments: A Practical Guide to A/B Testing
papers.authors: Ron Kohavi, Diane Tang, Ya Xu
papers.description: The definitive industry textbook on A/B testing covering experiment design, metrics, platforms, and pitfalls.

papers.title: Online Controlled Experiments at Large Scale
papers.authors: Ron Kohavi, Alex Deng, Brian Frasca, et al.
papers.description: How Microsoft runs thousands of experiments on millions of users, with practical lessons on metric selection and sample ratio mismatch.

papers.title: Overlapping Experiment Infrastructure: More, Better, Faster Experimentation
papers.authors: Diane Tang, Ashish Agarwal, Deirdre O'Brien, Mike Meyer
papers.description: Google's infrastructure for running overlapping experiments, enabling hundreds of simultaneous tests without interference.

papers.title: Improving the Sensitivity of Online Controlled Experiments by Utilizing Pre-Experiment Data (CUPED)
papers.authors: Alex Deng, Ya Xu, Ron Kohavi, Toby Walker
papers.description: The CUPED method that uses pre-experiment covariates to dramatically reduce variance in experiment metrics.

papers.title: Regression Adjustments for Analyzing Randomized Experiments
papers.authors: Winston Lin
papers.description: Shows how regression adjustment in randomized experiments yields valid inference even with heterogeneous treatment effects.

papers.title: Variance Reduction in Randomized Experiments
papers.authors: Susan Athey, Guido Imbens
papers.description: Optimal stratification and regression adjustment methods for experimental data with theoretical guarantees.

papers.title: Peeking at A/B Tests: Why It Matters, and What to Do About It
papers.authors: Ramesh Johari, Pete Koomen, Leonid Pekelis, David Walsh
papers.description: Analyzes the peeking problem in A/B tests and introduces always-valid p-values for sequential testing.

papers.title: Safe Testing
papers.authors: Peter Grünwald, Rianne de Heide, Wouter Koolen
papers.description: E-values and safe anytime-valid inference that allows optional stopping while controlling type I error.

papers.title: A/B Testing with Fat Tails
papers.authors: Eduardo Azevedo, Alex Deng, José Montiel Olea, Justin Rao, E. Glen Weyl
papers.description: Addresses the problem of highly variable metrics in experiments and proposes robust statistical methods.

papers.title: Detecting Network Effects: Randomizing Over Randomized Experiments
papers.authors: Dean Eckles, Brian Karrer, Johan Ugander
papers.description: Graph cluster randomization and design-based methods for detecting interference in network experiments.

papers.title: Estimating Peer Effects in Networks with Peer Encouragement Designs
papers.authors: Dean Eckles, René Kizilcec, Eytan Bakshy
papers.description: Two-stage randomization design for identifying peer effects in social networks.

papers.title: Experimentation in Two-Sided Marketplaces
papers.authors: Ramesh Johari, Hannah Li, Inessa Liskovich, Gabriel Weintraub
papers.description: Framework for experiments in marketplaces where treatment of one side affects the other.

papers.title: Switchback Experiments and Randomized Experiments for Estimating Platform-Level Effects
papers.authors: David Holtz, Ruben Lobel, Inessa Liskovich, Sinan Aral
papers.description: Design and analysis of switchback experiments for marketplace interventions at Airbnb.

papers.title: Causal Impact: A New Approach to Estimate Causal Effects
papers.authors: Kay Brodersen, Fabian Gallusser, Jim Koehler, et al.
papers.description: Google's Bayesian structural time-series approach for measuring impact of geo-level interventions.

papers.title: GeoLift: Open Source Solution for Measuring Incremental Impact
papers.authors: Arturo Esquerra, Nicolas Besasie
papers.description: Meta's open-source tool for geo-experiment design and measurement using synthetic control methods.

papers.title: Surrogate Index: Combining Short-Term Proxies to Estimate Long-Term Treatment Effects
papers.authors: Susan Athey, Raj Chetty, Guido Imbens, Hyunseung Kang
papers.description: Framework for using short-term outcomes to predict long-term treatment effects in experiments.

papers.title: Long-term Causal Inference Under Persistent Confounding via Data Combination
papers.authors: Guido Imbens, Nathan Kallus, Xiaojie Mao, Yuhao Wang
papers.description: Methods for combining experimental and observational data to estimate persistent treatment effects.

topics.name: Observational Causal Inference
topics.description: Matching, DiD, synthetic control, IV, RDD, double ML

papers.title: The Central Role of the Propensity Score in Observational Studies
papers.authors: Paul Rosenbaum, Donald Rubin
papers.description: The foundational paper introducing propensity scores for causal inference in observational studies.

papers.title: Matching as Nonparametric Preprocessing for Reducing Model Dependence
papers.authors: Gary King, Richard Nielsen
papers.description: Best practices for matching methods and the MatchIt software implementation.

papers.title: Double/Debiased Machine Learning for Treatment and Structural Parameters
papers.authors: Victor Chernozhukov, Denis Chetverikov, Mert Demirer, et al.
papers.description: The double ML framework using cross-fitting to obtain valid inference with ML first-stage estimation.

subtopics.name: Difference-in-Differences
subtopics.application: Policy changes, feature rollouts, staggered adoption

papers.title: What's Trending in Difference-in-Differences? A Synthesis of the Recent Econometrics Literature
papers.authors: Jonathan Roth, Pedro Sant'Anna, Alyssa Bilinski, John Poe
papers.description: Comprehensive review of modern DiD methods including staggered adoption and heterogeneous effects.

papers.title: Difference-in-Differences with Variation in Treatment Timing
papers.authors: Andrew Goodman-Bacon
papers.description: Decomposes two-way fixed effects estimators and reveals issues with staggered DiD designs.

papers.title: Difference-in-Differences with Multiple Time Periods
papers.authors: Brantly Callaway, Pedro Sant'Anna
papers.description: Group-time average treatment effects and aggregation methods for staggered DiD.

subtopics.name: Synthetic Control
subtopics.application: Geo lift, market entry, one-treated-unit settings

papers.title: Synthetic Control Methods for Comparative Case Studies
papers.authors: Alberto Abadie, Alexis Diamond, Jens Hainmueller
papers.description: The foundational synthetic control paper with the California tobacco application.

papers.title: Using Synthetic Controls: Feasibility, Data Requirements, and Methodological Aspects
papers.authors: Alberto Abadie
papers.description: Practical guidance on when and how to apply synthetic control methods.

papers.title: Synthetic Difference in Differences
papers.authors: Dmitry Arkhangelsky, Susan Athey, David Hirshberg, et al.
papers.description: Combines synthetic control and DiD for improved inference in panel data settings.

papers.title: Identification and Estimation of Local Average Treatment Effects
papers.authors: Guido Imbens, Joshua Angrist
papers.description: The LATE framework for interpreting IV estimates as effects on compliers.

papers.title: Identification of Causal Effects Using Instrumental Variables
papers.authors: Joshua Angrist, Guido Imbens, Donald Rubin
papers.description: Defines the assumptions needed for IV and connects to potential outcomes framework.

papers.title: Regression Discontinuity Designs in Economics
papers.authors: David Lee, Thomas Lemieux
papers.description: Comprehensive guide to RDD identification, estimation, and practical implementation.

papers.title: A Practical Introduction to Regression Discontinuity Designs
papers.authors: Matias Cattaneo, Nicolas Idrobo, Rocio Titiunik
papers.description: Modern implementation guide with rdrobust software for sharp and fuzzy RDD.

papers.title: Estimation and Inference of Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Random Forests
papers.authors: Stefan Wager, Susan Athey
papers.description: Causal forests for estimating conditional average treatment effects with valid confidence intervals.

papers.title: Generic Machine Learning Inference on Heterogeneous Treatment Effects in Randomized Experiments
papers.authors: Victor Chernozhukov, Mert Demirer, Esther Duflo, Ivan Fernández-Val
papers.description: Framework for using any ML method to find heterogeneous effects with valid inference.

papers.title: Metalearners for Estimating Heterogeneous Treatment Effects using Machine Learning
papers.authors: Sören Künzel, Jasjeet Sekhon, Peter Bickel, Bin Yu
papers.description: Taxonomy of metalearners (S-learner, T-learner, X-learner) for CATE estimation.

papers.title: Sensitivity Analysis in Observational Research: Introducing the E-Value
papers.authors: Tyler VanderWeele, Peng Ding
papers.description: The E-value for quantifying sensitivity to unmeasured confounding.

papers.title: Making Sense of Sensitivity: Extending Omitted Variable Bias
papers.authors: Carlos Cinelli, Chad Hazlett
papers.description: Modern sensitivity analysis framework with intuitive benchmarking against observed covariates.

topics.name: Pricing
topics.description: Dynamic pricing, surge, markdown, demand estimation

papers.title: The Theory and Practice of Revenue Management
papers.authors: Kalyan Talluri, Garrett van Ryzin
papers.description: The definitive textbook on revenue management covering pricing, capacity control, and overbooking.

papers.title: Dynamic Pricing in the Presence of Inventory Considerations
papers.authors: Yossi Aviv, Amit Pazgal
papers.description: Framework for dynamic pricing with finite inventory and strategic consumers.

papers.title: Pricing and Revenue Optimization
papers.authors: Robert Phillips
papers.description: Comprehensive practitioner's guide to pricing strategy and optimization techniques.

papers.title: Clearance Pricing and Inventory Policies for Retail Chains
papers.authors: Stephen Smith, Dale Achabal
papers.description: Multi-location markdown optimization balancing store-level heterogeneity.

papers.title: Dynamic Pricing with a Prior on Market Response
papers.authors: Omar Besbes, Assaf Zeevi
papers.description: Bayesian approach to learning demand while optimizing markdown paths.

papers.title: Dynamic Pricing and Matching in Ride-Hailing Platforms
papers.authors: Hongyao Ma, Fei Fang, David Parkes
papers.description: Joint optimization of pricing and matching in two-sided rideshare markets.

papers.title: Surge Pricing Solves the Wild Goose Chase
papers.authors: Juan Castillo, Dan Knoepfle, Glen Weyl
papers.description: Empirical analysis of Uber's surge pricing showing welfare improvements from reduced search frictions.

papers.title: The Value of Flexible Work: Evidence from Uber Drivers
papers.authors: M. Keith Chen, Judith Chevalier, Peter Rossi, Emily Oehlsen
papers.description: Estimates labor supply elasticity and value of flexibility using Uber driver data.

papers.title: Personalized Pricing and Consumer Welfare
papers.authors: Jean-Pierre Dubé, Sanjog Misra
papers.description: Analyzes welfare effects of machine learning-based personalized pricing.

papers.title: Algorithmic Pricing and Competition
papers.authors: Zach Brown, Alexander MacKay
papers.description: How algorithmic pricing affects competition and market outcomes.

papers.title: Automobile Prices in Market Equilibrium (BLP)
papers.authors: Steven Berry, James Levinsohn, Ariel Pakes
papers.description: The foundational random coefficients discrete choice model for demand estimation.

papers.title: Empirical Models of Consumer Behavior
papers.authors: Aviv Nevo
papers.description: Practical guide to implementing BLP-style demand models with market-level data.

papers.title: pyBLP: BLP Demand Estimation in Python
papers.authors: Jeff Gortmaker, Chris Conlon
papers.description: Modern implementation and extensions of BLP with diagnostics and best practices.

topics.name: Subscriptions & Retention
topics.description: Churn, CLV, engagement, freemium

papers.title: Customer Churn Prediction: A Survey
papers.authors: Wouter Verbeke, Karel Dejaeger, David Martens, et al.

papers.title: Churn Prediction in Mobile Social Games: Towards a Complete Assessment Using Survival Ensembles
papers.authors: Á. Periáñez, A. Saas, A. Guitart, C. Magne
papers.description: Survival analysis approach to churn with right-censoring and dynamic hazards.

papers.title: Counting Your Customers: Who Are They and What Will They Do Next? (BG/NBD)
papers.authors: Peter Fader, Bruce Hardie, Ka Lok Lee
papers.description: The BG/NBD model for customer lifetime value with transaction data.

papers.title: 'Counting Your Customers' the Easy Way: An Alternative to the Pareto/NBD Model
papers.authors: Peter Fader, Bruce Hardie, Ka Lok Lee
papers.description: Simplified BG/NBD model that maintains predictive accuracy with easier estimation.

papers.title: Customer-Base Valuation in a Contractual Setting: The Perils of Ignoring Heterogeneity
papers.authors: Peter Fader, Bruce Hardie
papers.description: Shifted-Beta-Geometric model for subscription businesses with discrete renewal periods.

papers.title: Freemium as a Marketing Strategy
papers.authors: Clarence Lee, Vineet Kumar, Sunil Gupta
papers.description: Structural model of freemium conversion analyzing optimal feature restriction.

papers.title: Making Freemium Work
papers.authors: Vineet Kumar
papers.description: Practitioner framework for freemium strategy and conversion optimization.

papers.title: Does Retaining Customers Pay Off?
papers.authors: Werner Reinartz, V. Kumar
papers.description: Empirical analysis of the relationship between customer tenure and profitability.

papers.title: The Effects of Customer Satisfaction on Customer Spending
papers.authors: Lerzan Aksoy, Bruce Cooil, Keiningham, Tor
papers.description: Links satisfaction metrics to retention and share of wallet outcomes.

papers.title: Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products
papers.authors: Nir Eyal
papers.description: The Hook Model framework for designing engaging product experiences.

papers.title: Habits: A Repeat Performance
papers.authors: Wendy Wood, David Neal
papers.description: Psychology research on habit formation, cues, and behavior change.
